artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsujiokaya Kamekichi; Carver: Watanabe Yatarō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 479.1; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 201, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets; man at right holding a large rectangular lantern, emitting pinkish light; man, partially hidden by lantern, wears orange checked kimono with red and purple lining, and holds a bloody sword, with blood on his PR leg and the hem of his kimono; man's face has brown spots; falling woman at left wearing kimono with brown ground and blue birds and white flowers on purple ground, with light blue and red lining, scattering floating sheets of white paper
dimension: 14 5/8 × 9 3/4 in. (37.15 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 彫弥太 {hori Yata}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Newly Selected Eastern Brocade Prints (Shinsen Azuma nishiki-e 新撰東錦絵)
title: Story of Sano Jirōzaemon
